fields.description: true if the service principal account is enabled; otherwise, false. If set to false, then no users are able to sign in to this app, even if they're assigned to it. Supports $filter (eq, ne, not, in).
fields.name: AccountEnabled

fields.description: Defines custom behavior that a consuming service can use to call an app in specific contexts. For example, applications that can render file streams may set the addIns property for its 'FileHandler' functionality. This lets services like Microsoft 365 call the application in the context of a document the user is working on.
fields.name: AddIns

fields.description: Used to retrieve service principals by subscription, identify resource group and full resource IDs for managed identities. Supports $filter (eq, not, ge, le, startsWith).
fields.name: AlternativeNames

fields.description: The description exposed by the associated application.
fields.name: AppDescription

fields.description: The display name exposed by the associated application.
fields.name: AppDisplayName

fields.description: The unique identifier for the associated application (its appId property). Alternate key. Supports $filter (eq, ne, not, in, startsWith).
fields.name: AppId

fields.description: The appManagementPolicy applied to this service principal.
fields.name: AppManagementPolicies

fields.description: Contains the tenant ID where the application is registered. This is applicable only to service principals backed by applications. Supports $filter (eq, ne, NOT, ge, le).
fields.name: AppOwnerOrganizationId

fields.description: App role assignments for this app or service, granted to users, groups, and other service principals.Supports $expand.
fields.name: AppRoleAssignedTo

fields.description: Specifies whether users or other service principals need to be granted an app role assignment for this service principal before users can sign in or apps can get tokens. The default value is false. Not nullable. Supports $filter (eq, ne, NOT).
fields.name: AppRoleAssignmentRequired

fields.description: App role assignment for another app or service, granted to this service principal. Supports $expand.
fields.name: AppRoleAssignments

fields.description: The roles exposed by the application, which this service principal represents. For more information, see the appRoles property definition on the application entity. Not nullable.
fields.name: AppRoles

fields.description: Unique identifier of the applicationTemplate. Supports $filter (eq, not, ne). Read-only. null if the app wasn't created from an application template.
fields.name: ApplicationTemplateId

fields.description: The claimsMappingPolicies assigned to this service principal. Supports $expand.
fields.name: ClaimsMappingPolicies

fields.description: A claims policy that allows application admins to customize the claims that will be emitted in tokens affected by this policy.
fields.name: ClaimsPolicy

fields.description: Directory objects created by this service principal. Read-only. Nullable.
fields.name: CreatedObjects

fields.description: List of OData IDs for `CreatedObjects` to bind to this entity
fields.name: CreatedObjects_ODataBind

fields.description: An open complex type that holds the value of a custom security attribute that is assigned to a directory object. Nullable. Returned only on $select. Supports $filter (eq, ne, not, startsWith). Filter value is case sensitive.
fields.name: CustomSecurityAttributes

fields.description: The permission classifications for delegated permissions exposed by the app that this service principal represents. Supports $expand.
fields.name: DelegatedPermissionClassifications

fields.description: Free text field to provide an internal end-user facing description of the service principal. End-user portals such MyApps displays the application description in this field. The maximum allowed size is 1,024 characters. Supports $filter (eq, ne, not, ge, le, startsWith) and $search.
fields.name: Description

fields.description: Specifies whether Microsoft has disabled the registered application. Possible values are: null (default value), NotDisabled, and DisabledDueToViolationOfServicesAgreement (reasons may include suspicious, abusive, or malicious activity, or a violation of the Microsoft Services Agreement).  Supports $filter (eq, ne, not).
fields.name: DisabledByMicrosoftStatus

fields.description: The display name for the service principal. Supports $filter (eq, ne, not, ge, le, in, startsWith, and eq on null values), $search, and $orderby.
fields.name: DisplayName

fields.description: Endpoints available for discovery. Services like Sharepoint populate this property with a tenant specific SharePoint endpoints that other applications can discover and use in their experiences.
fields.name: Endpoints

fields.description: Deprecated. Don't use.
fields.name: ErrorUrl

fields.description: The homeRealmDiscoveryPolicies assigned to this service principal. Supports $expand.
fields.name: HomeRealmDiscoveryPolicies

fields.description: Home page or landing page of the application.
fields.name: Homepage

fields.description: Basic profile information of the acquired application such as app's marketing, support, terms of service and privacy statement URLs. The terms of service and privacy statement are surfaced to users through the user consent experience. For more info, see How to: Add Terms of service and privacy statement for registered Microsoft Entra apps. Supports $filter (eq, ne, not, ge, le, and eq on null values).
fields.name: Info

fields.description: The collection of key credentials associated with the service principal. Not nullable. Supports $filter (eq, not, ge, le).
fields.name: KeyCredentials

fields.description: Specifies the URL where the service provider redirects the user to Microsoft Entra ID to authenticate. Microsoft Entra ID uses the URL to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Microsoft Entra My Apps. When blank, Microsoft Entra ID performs IdP-initiated sign-on for applications configured with SAML-based single sign-on. The user launches the application from Microsoft 365, the Microsoft Entra My Apps, or the Microsoft Entra SSO URL.
fields.name: LoginUrl

fields.description: Specifies the URL that the Microsoft's authorization service uses to sign out a user using OpenId Connect front-channel, back-channel, or SAML sign out protocols.
fields.name: LogoutUrl

fields.description: Roles that this service principal is a member of. HTTP Methods: GET Read-only. Nullable. Supports $expand.
fields.name: MemberOf

fields.description: List of OData IDs for `MemberOf` to bind to this entity
fields.name: MemberOf_ODataBind

fields.description: Free text field to capture information about the service principal, typically used for operational purposes. Maximum allowed size is 1,024 characters.
fields.name: Notes

fields.description: Specifies the list of email addresses where Microsoft Entra ID sends a notification when the active certificate is near the expiration date. This is only for the certificates used to sign the SAML token issued for Microsoft Entra Gallery applications.
fields.name: NotificationEmailAddresses

fields.description: Delegated permission grants authorizing this service principal to access an API on behalf of a signed-in user. Read-only. Nullable.
fields.name: OAuth2PermissionGrants

fields.description: Directory objects that are owned by this service principal. Read-only. Nullable. Supports $expand and $filter (/$count eq 0, /$count ne 0, /$count eq 1, /$count ne 1).
fields.name: OwnedObjects

fields.description: List of OData IDs for `OwnedObjects` to bind to this entity
fields.name: OwnedObjects_ODataBind

fields.description: Directory objects that are owners of this servicePrincipal. The owners are a set of nonadmin users or servicePrincipals who are allowed to modify this object. Read-only. Nullable.  Supports $expand and $filter (/$count eq 0, /$count ne 0, /$count eq 1, /$count ne 1).
fields.name: Owners

fields.description: List of OData IDs for `Owners` to bind to this entity
fields.name: Owners_ODataBind

fields.description: The collection of password credentials associated with the service principal. Not nullable.
fields.name: PasswordCredentials

fields.description: The collection for settings related to password single sign-on. Use $select=passwordSingleSignOnSettings to read the property. Read-only for applicationTemplates except for custom applicationTemplates.
fields.name: PasswordSingleSignOnSettings

fields.description: Specifies the single sign-on mode configured for this application. Microsoft Entra ID uses the preferred single sign-on mode to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Microsoft Entra My Apps. The supported values are password, saml, notSupported, and oidc.
fields.name: PreferredSingleSignOnMode

fields.description: Specifies the expiration date of the keyCredential used for token signing, marked by preferredTokenSigningKeyThumbprint. Updating this attribute isn't currently supported. For details, see ServicePrincipal property differences.
fields.name: PreferredTokenSigningKeyEndDateTime

fields.description: This property can be used on SAML applications (apps that have preferredSingleSignOnMode set to saml) to control which certificate is used to sign the SAML responses. For applications that aren't SAML, don't write or otherwise rely on this property.
fields.name: PreferredTokenSigningKeyThumbprint

fields.description: The delegated permissions exposed by the application. For more information, see the oauth2PermissionScopes property on the application entity's api property. Not nullable. Note: This property is named oauth2PermissionScopes in v1.0.
fields.name: PublishedPermissionScopes

fields.description: The name of the Microsoft Entra tenant that published the application.
fields.name: PublisherName

fields.description: The remoteDesktopSecurityConfiguration object applied to this service principal. Supports $filter (eq) for isRemoteDesktopProtocolEnabled property.
fields.name: RemoteDesktopSecurityConfiguration

fields.description: The URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in with the associated application, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to for the associated application. Not nullable.
fields.name: ReplyUrls

fields.description: The url where the service exposes SAML metadata for federation.
fields.name: SamlMetadataUrl

fields.description: The collection for settings related to saml single sign-on.
fields.name: SamlSingleSignOnSettings

fields.description: Contains the list of identifiersUris, copied over from the associated application. More values can be added to hybrid applications. These values can be used to identify the permissions exposed by this app within Microsoft Entra ID. For example,Client apps can specify a resource URI that is based on the values of this property to acquire an access token, which is the URI returned in the 'aud' claim.The any operator is required for filter expressions on multi-valued properties. Not nullable.  Supports $filter (eq, not, ge, le, startsWith).
fields.name: ServicePrincipalNames

fields.description: Identifies if the service principal represents an application or a managed identity. This is set by Microsoft Entra ID internally. For a service principal that represents an application this is set as Application. For a service principal that represents a managed identity this is set as ManagedIdentity. The SocialIdp type is for internal use.
fields.name: ServicePrincipalType

fields.description: Specifies the Microsoft accounts that are supported for the current application. Read-only. Supported values are:AzureADMyOrg: Users with a Microsoft work or school account in my organization's Microsoft Entra tenant (single-tenant).AzureADMultipleOrgs: Users with a Microsoft work or school account in any organization's Microsoft Entra tenant (multitenant).AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount: Users with a personal Microsoft account, or a work or school account in any organization's Microsoft Entra tenant.PersonalMicrosoftAccount: Users with a personal Microsoft account only.
fields.name: SignInAudience

fields.description: Represents the capability for Microsoft Entra identity synchronization through the Microsoft Graph API.
fields.name: Synchronization

fields.description: Custom strings that can be used to categorize and identify the service principal. Not nullable. The value is the union of strings set here and on the associated application entity's tags property.Supports $filter (eq, not, ge, le, startsWith).
fields.name: Tags

fields.description: Specifies the keyId of a public key from the keyCredentials collection. When configured, Microsoft Entra ID issues tokens for this application encrypted using the key specified by this property. The application code that receives the encrypted token must use the matching private key to decrypt the token before it can be used for the signed-in user.
fields.name: TokenEncryptionKeyId

fields.description: The tokenIssuancePolicies assigned to this service principal. Supports $expand.
fields.name: TokenIssuancePolicies

fields.description: The tokenLifetimePolicies assigned to this service principal. Supports $expand.
fields.name: TokenLifetimePolicies

fields.description: List of OData IDs for `TransitiveMemberOf` to bind to this entity
fields.name: TransitiveMemberOf_ODataBind

fields.description: Specifies the verified publisher of the application that's linked to this service principal.
fields.name: VerifiedPublisher
